normalised: telecommunications: fiber to home expansion gains momentum

unnormalised: Mumbai, October 26th – Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure across India, aiming to connect millions of homes and businesses to high-speed internet. JioFiber recently announced the completion of laying over 350,000 km of optical fiber cable, reaching over 1,600 cities. Airtel Xstream Fiber is focusing on dense urban areas, particularly in Delhi-NCR and Bangalore, offering speeds up to 1 Gbps.
normalised: mumbai, october twenty sixth – reliance jio and bharti airtel are aggressively expanding their fiber to home (f t t h) infrastructure across india, aiming to connect millions of homes and businesses to high speed internet. jiofiber recently announced the completion of laying over three hundred and fifty thousand kilometer of optical fiber cable, reaching over one thousand six hundred cities. airtel xstream fiber is focusing on dense urban areas, particularly in delhi-n c r and bangalore, offering speeds up to one gigabit per second.

unnormalised: Dr. Meera Sharma, a telecom analyst at IIT-Delhi, notes that "FTTH is crucial for supporting India's growing digital economy, enabling everything from online education to e-commerce." The Government of India's BharatNet project is also playing a vital role in connecting rural areas.
normalised: doctor meera sharma, a telecom analyst at i i t-delhi, notes that "f t t h is crucial for supporting india's growing digital economy, enabling everything from online education to e-commerce." the government of india's bharatnet project is also playing a vital role in connecting rural areas.

unnormalised: However, challenges remain, including right-of-way issues and high installation costs, especially in older buildings. Some apartment complexes in Mumbai, averaging 800 sq ft per unit, are facing delays due to logistical hurdles. The cost of connection can reach Rs. 5,000 in some cases, making affordability a factor. Further investment and streamlined regulations are needed to accelerate FTTH deployment nationwide.
